brief_summary.textblock: Examination of application and efficacy of Smart Shock algorithm in ICD patients

clinical_study.condition: Focus of Study is Efficacy of Smart Shock Algorithm in ICD Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients implanted an Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD) with smart shock
             algorithm

          -  written informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients with life expectancy less than 24 months

          -  patients younger than 18 years

          -  pregnant or breast feeding women

study_pop.textblock: Patients that suffuse the inclusion criteria and signed the informed consent

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices

primary_outcome.description: Effectiveness will be measured by the aim of Smart Shock algorithms: the reduction of shocks. Utilisation will be measured by the programming of Smart Shock algorithms and detection of tachycardia, the deviance from nominal parameters and the application of Smart Shock algorithms. To get impression of the necessarity for ICD therapy in these patients, the risk of ventricular and atrial arrhythmia will be examined in the patient population included in the study. To determine the effect of Smart Shock technology, the relative fraction of episodes which are not treated by shock delivery due to Smart Shock, will be measured. It is assumed, that a total 95% confidence interval of 10% is sufficient from a medical point of view.
primary_outcome.measure: Determine the relative reduction of shock related episodes with Smart shock technology

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: evaluation of relative shock reduction due to Smart shock technology
programming vs. nominal parameters dependant of baseline data

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
